Topic.Title: Republicans are only 20% of the Nation.

Message.Msg: 65 million voted for Obama. 61 million voted for Romney (both figures rounded off). That total was 58.9 % of the eligible voters. The numbers in this nation that identify themselves by registration as republican or democrat is smaller than those that voted for either party. The point is while Fox news and the RNC would like for you to think that the republican party represents near 50% of the American people by any measurement is not an accurate statement by any stretch of the imagination. My figure remains correct. Less than 20% of Americans voted republican or registered themselves as republicans in 2012. Nothing can be assumed about the 59% that did not vote from the proportions of those that did, certainly not that the country is equally divided on all issues along Republican and Democrat points of view on any argument. The only point that can be made is that less than 20% of Americans agreed with the republican candidates arguments enough to bother to vote for him.

Message.Title: European Parliament President Martin Schulz views the European Union as headed for a depression
Message.Msg: European Parliament President Martin Schulz views the European Union as headed for a depression Jan. 19, 2013 Schulz says EU on path to depression: report European Parliament President Martin Schulz views the European Union as headed for a depression, according to an interview with Saturday's edition of the Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung. "[The E.U.] is on a path to a depression, apathy, a mood of not caring. That's dangerous, as that mood superimposes the great successes of the E.U., for which it recently won the Nobel Peace Prize," Mr. Schulz is quoted as saying.

Message.Title: Global Unemployment to Surge Past 2009 Record World Unemployment to Hit Record High in 2013: ILO
Message.Msg: Global Unemployment to Surge Past 2009 Record World Unemployment to Hit Record High in 2013: ILO In its 2013 Global Employment Trends report, the ILO forecasts unemployment numbers will rise by 5.1 million in 2013 to reach 202 million, topping 2009's record. The report also predicts unemployment will rise further in 2014 to reach 205 million. "Unemployment remains as dire as it was during the crisis in 2009," Ekkehard Ernst, chief of the employment trends unit at the ILO, which wrote the report, told CNBC.

Topic.Title: The Teapublicans stand for an America

Message.Msg: Progress, as you define it, killed 100 million people in the 20th century. Progress, as you define it, is something to be abhored, it's practitioners and preachers and advocates shunned by society. You don't even know what you want, and your post proves it. You want what "they" tell you to want. What you want doesn't exist. You are a bigger idiot than those who came before you. They didn't believe in the cause, they just wanted power and money. You are an idiot who believes in a cause that has no leader. No, not even Obama. He isn't in it for the change; he's in it for himself. There is no cause, it's an idealogical sham that's really about the power and the money. And you've been had. I'm sure that feeling isn't new to you. A person can't believe in meaningless emotional drivel their whole life without being constantly taken advantage of by every drive-by con artist and propaganda preacher. How much of your meager allowance have you poured down the drains on work-from-home get rich quick programs, memberships in ponzi schemes, and traveling hords of gypsies? With your emotional attachments to anything that sounds good, it's a sure bet that you are seriously damaged goods. I'm sorry for your devastation, but you need to get a clue to right the ship and turn your lot around.
